alert.note: Alert for Roseau (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 1:49AM CDT until April 17 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Minnesota... Wild Rice River (MN) at Twin Valley affecting Norman County. .Snowmelt river flooding to continue. Rate of rise and ultimate crest is uncertain due to rate of ongoing snowmelt runoff and possible rain and colder temperatures in the forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Roseau River at Roseau. * WHEN...Until Monday. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Storm sewer pumping is initiated at certain locations in the city. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 17.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this weekend into early next week. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
